dict.string: Renames a directory or file (preserving the extension)

tmpFile="/tmp/renameactionfile" originalFile="{query}"
echo -n "${originalFile}" > "${tmpFile}"
fileName=$(basename "${originalFile}")
fileExtension=$(echo "${fileName}" | sed -n 's/\(.*\)\.\(.*\)$/.\2/p') fileNoExtension=$(echo "${fileName}" | sed 's/\(.*\)\.\(.*\)$/\1/')
osascript -e " tell application \"Alfred 3\" to run trigger \"rename\" in workflow \"com.vitorgalvao.alfred.renameaction\" with argument \"${fileNoExtension}\" tell application \"System Events\" key code 123 using command down key code 124 using {command down, shift down} end tell "

tmpFile="/tmp/renameactionfile" originalFile="$(cat ${tmpFile})"
filePath=$(dirname "${originalFile}") fileName=$(basename "${originalFile}")
fileExtension=$(echo "${fileName}" | sed -n 's/\(.*\)\.\(.*\)$/.\2/p') fileNoExtension=$(echo "{fileName}" | sed 's/\(.*\)\.\(.*\)$/\1/')
mv "${originalFile}" "${filePath}/{query}${fileExtension}"
rm "${tmpFile}"
You don’t need to write the extension — it will be preserved

File action to rename the selected directory or file (preserving the extension).
Use Alfred to pick what you want to rename and choose `Rename` as the action. Alfred’s main window will appear and you type a new name (don’t include the file extension).
